name.description: The name of the blueprint. Keep this short and descriptive.

description.description: The description of the blueprint. While optional, this field is highly recommended. For example, to describe what the blueprint does, or tell more about the options inputs of the blueprint provide. The description can include Markdown.

domain.description: The domain name this blueprint provides a blueprint for. Currently, only 'automation' and 'script' are supported.

homeassistant.description: Home Assistant requirements to be able to use the blueprint successfully.

input.description: A dictionary of defined user inputs. These are the input fields that the consumer of your blueprint can provide using YAML definition, or via a configuration form in the UI.

name.description: The name of the input field.

description.description: A short description of the input field. Keep this short and descriptive. The description can include Markdown.

selector.description: The selector to use for this input. A selector defines how the input is displayed in the frontend UI.

default.description: The default value of this input, in case the input is not provided by the user of this blueprint.
